I cannot find any indication on my system of the presence of
java.version=1.3.1_01 anywhere on my system.

G: I'm not sure, but it's possible that you get this problem because you run
Eclipse on Sun 1.3.1_01 (the latest Sun 1.3.1 release is _09, the only released
VM currently supported by Sun is the 1.4.2_03).

If Eclipse says it runs on 1.3.1_01, it's because the VM says so. You can try to
find where the VM is installed. Do 'java -version' on a command line, if you get
'java version "1.3.1_01"', that means the VM is in your PATH, check its value to
find where. You can also check the environment variable JAVA_HOME.

Anyway, if you want to launch Eclipse on an different VM, use 'eclipse -vm
<path_to_the_javaw.exe_you_want_to_use>' to launch Eclipse.

Which version of Eclipse are you using?

Also, please try running Eclipse on a newer VM and let us know if the problem 
goes away.

I have discovered that there is a 1.3.1_01 on my system because of Oracle tools
installation.  I have set eclipse to use my 1.4.2 installation.  I have not had
this experience since then.
